title: Paul the Panda
synopsis: Paul's clumsy attempts to win the heart of Grace the Giraffe at the city zoo.
visual_style: 1920s vintage illustration style with colorful but faded tones and restrained ink linework. Hand-drawn and slightly unfinished, with subtle imperfections and confident, deliberate lines from a professional illustrator. Extremely minimal detail: sparse backgrounds, few elements, and generous empty space. Artistic, old-fashioned, and unpolished—nothing modern or childish. Single full-bleed image with no frames, borders, or panels.

locations.name: City Zoo
locations.description: A large traditional zoo with stone-walled enclosures, winding visitor paths, old oak trees, and a central fountain. Animals roam freely between exhibits during social hours.

locations.name: Panda Enclosure
locations.description: A bamboo-filled enclosure with a tire swing, a shallow pond, and a cozy wooden shelter. Paul's home turf.

locations.name: Giraffe Paddock
locations.description: A tall-fenced open paddock with acacia trees and elevated feeding platforms. Grace's elegant domain.

characters.name: Paul
characters.description: A round, chubby giant panda with soft black-and-white fur, expressive dark eyes, and a slightly dopey but endearing smile. Well-meaning, clumsy, and hopelessly romantic.

characters.name: Grace
characters.description: A tall, graceful giraffe with warm golden-brown patches, long eyelashes, and a calm, composed demeanor. Kind but oblivious to Paul's advances.

rules: The animals behave like animals but with human-like emotions and social dynamics.
Paul's attempts to impress Grace should always backfire in funny, physical-comedy ways.
The tone is always warm and lighthearted — never mean-spirited.
long_term_narrative: Paul keeps finding creative but doomed ways to get Grace's attention.
Each attempt escalates in ambition and comedic disaster.
final_outcomes: Paul wins Grace's heart and they become an unlikely but adorable couple
Grace rejects Paul and he is left heartbroken
